title: Six Flags Darien Lake
data: A traditional Bumper Cars attraction . Guests drive around in one direction
S & S Power Space Shot design
A Drop Tower ride relocated from Alabama Adventure , which closed in 2011 . Stands on the former spot of the Raging Seas
An original Swing Around . Part of the Huss showcase . This ride was called Rodeo Round Up when the park was owned by Six Flags . The name was changed back to Corn Popper in 2010
A 165 feet ( 50 m ) tall ferris wheel . It was originally part of the 1982 World 's Fair in Knoxville , Tennessee and was the tallest in the United States when constructed
A traditional carousel . It received a large refurbishment before the start of the 2013 season
A Paratrooper-style ride , the only one of its kind
A traditional wave swinger ride . Lasso was previously located where the Emporium currently stands . It is now located where Crazy Quilt once stood
A swinging pirate ship ride on the edge of Fun Lake . It was installed as part of the HUSS showcase
A Larson Giant Loop model which is located on the former site of UFO

A standard scrambler ride that originally opened in 1999 . It was removed before the 2012 season to make way for the Rowdy 's Ridge family area . The ride remained in storage until the middle of the 2014 season , when it returned in a new location next to The Predator
The only Enterprise manufactured by Heintz Fahtze in operation
A Funtime Starflyer model that swings riders 242 feet high in the air at 35 mph . It is set to open at Darien Lake in 2019 under its new Six Flags branding
section_title: Current rides and attractions -- Flat and vertical rides
section_text: Many of the rides manufactured by Huss Park Attractions were installed as part of a deal with Huss to use Darien Lake as a North American showcase for Huss 's new rides in the early 1980s .
intro: Six Flags Darien Lake is a resort located in Darien, New York, that features a theme park, water park, campground and lodging. It is owned by EPR Properties and operated by Six Flags.
